intro: Erythroxylum ulei var. ulei, commonly known as the Brazilian peppercorn, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Erythroxylaceae family and is characterized by its small, greenish-white flowers and elliptical, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, round berries that turn red when mature, containing a single seed. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it has been introduced to other parts of the world.
